segment.source: Bluetooth GATT
segment.target: Bluetooth GATT

segment.source: This article provides an overview of Bluetooth Generic Attribute Profile (GATT) for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, along with sample code for three common GATT scenarios: retrieving Bluetooth data, controlling a Bluetooth LE thermometer device, and controlling the presentation of Bluetooth LE device data.
segment.target: This article provides an overview of Bluetooth Generic Attribute Profile (GATT) for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, along with sample code for three common GATT scenarios: retrieving Bluetooth data, controlling a Bluetooth LE thermometer device, and controlling the presentation of Bluetooth LE device data.

segment.source: Bluetooth GATT
segment.target: Bluetooth GATT

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: ** Important APIs
segment.target: ** Important APIs

segment.source: Windows.Devices.Bluetooth
segment.target: Windows.Devices.Bluetooth

segment.source: Windows.Devices.Bluetooth.GenericAttributeProfile
segment.target: Windows.Devices.Bluetooth.GenericAttributeProfile

segment.source: This article provides an overview of Bluetooth Generic Attribute Profile (GATT) for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, along with sample code for three common GATT scenarios: retrieving Bluetooth data, controlling a Bluetooth LE thermometer device, and controlling the presentation of Bluetooth LE device data.
segment.target: This article provides an overview of Bluetooth Generic Attribute Profile (GATT) for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, along with sample code for three common GATT scenarios: retrieving Bluetooth data, controlling a Bluetooth LE thermometer device, and controlling the presentation of Bluetooth LE device data.

segment.source: Overview
segment.target: Overview

segment.source: Developers can use the APIs in the Windows.Devices.Bluetooth.GenericAttributeProfile namespace to access Bluetooth LE services, descriptors, and characteristics.
segment.target: Developers can use the APIs in the Windows.Devices.Bluetooth.GenericAttributeProfile namespace to access Bluetooth LE services, descriptors, and characteristics.

segment.source: Bluetooth LE devices expose their functionality through a collection of:
segment.target: Bluetooth LE devices expose their functionality through a collection of:

segment.source: Primary Services
segment.target: Primary Services

segment.source: Included Services
segment.target: Included Services

segment.source: Characteristics
segment.target: Characteristics

segment.source: Descriptors
segment.target: Descriptors

segment.source: Primary services define the functional contract of the LE device and contain a collection of characteristics that define the service.
segment.target: Primary services define the functional contract of the LE device and contain a collection of characteristics that define the service.

segment.source: Those characteristics, in turn, contain descriptors that describe the characteristics.
segment.target: Those characteristics, in turn, contain descriptors that describe the characteristics.

segment.source: The Bluetooth GATT APIs expose objects and functions, rather than access to the raw transport.
segment.target: The Bluetooth GATT APIs expose objects and functions, rather than access to the raw transport.

segment.source: At the driver level primary services are enumerated as Child Device Nodes of the Bluetooth LE device using the Windows.Devices.Enumeration APIs.
segment.target: At the driver level primary services are enumerated as Child Device Nodes of the Bluetooth LE device using the Windows.Devices.Enumeration APIs.

segment.source: The Bluetooth GATT APIs also enable developers to work with Bluetooth LE devices with the ability to perform the following tasks:
segment.target: The Bluetooth GATT APIs also enable developers to work with Bluetooth LE devices with the ability to perform the following tasks:

segment.source: Perform Service / Characteristic / Descriptor discovery
segment.target: Perform Service / Characteristic / Descriptor discovery

segment.source: Read and Write Characteristic / Descriptor values
segment.target: Read and Write Characteristic / Descriptor values

segment.source: Register a callback for the Characteristic ValueChanged event
segment.target: Register a callback for the Characteristic ValueChanged event

segment.source: The Bluetooth GATT APIs simplify development by dealing with common properties and providing reasonable defaults to aid in device management and configuration.
segment.target: The Bluetooth GATT APIs simplify development by dealing with common properties and providing reasonable defaults to aid in device management and configuration.

segment.source: They provide a means for developers to access functionality of a Bluetooth LE device from an app.
segment.target: They provide a means for developers to access functionality of a Bluetooth LE device from an app.

segment.source: To create a useful implementation a developer has to have prior knowledge of the GATT services and characteristics the application intends to consume, and to process the specific characteristic values such that the binary data provided by the API is transformed into useful data before being presented to the user.
segment.target: To create a useful implementation a developer has to have prior knowledge of the GATT services and characteristics the application intends to consume, and to process the specific characteristic values such that the binary data provided by the API is transformed into useful data before being presented to the user.

segment.source: The Bluetooth GATT APIs expose only the basic primitives required to communicate with a Bluetooth LE device.
segment.target: The Bluetooth GATT APIs expose only the basic primitives required to communicate with a Bluetooth LE device.

segment.source: To interpret the data, an application profile must be defined, either by a Bluetooth SIG standard profile, or a custom profile implemented by a device vendor.
segment.target: To interpret the data, an application profile must be defined, either by a Bluetooth SIG standard profile, or a custom profile implemented by a device vendor.

segment.source: A profile creates a binding contract between the application and the device, as to what the exchanged data represents and how to interpret it.
segment.target: A profile creates a binding contract between the application and the device, as to what the exchanged data represents and how to interpret it.

segment.source: For convenience the Bluetooth SIG maintains a list of public profiles available.
segment.target: For convenience the Bluetooth SIG maintains a list of public profiles available.

segment.source: Retrieve Bluetooth data
segment.target: Retrieve Bluetooth data

segment.source: In this example, the app consumes temperature measurements from a Bluetooth device that implements the Bluetooth LE Health Thermometer Service.
segment.target: In this example, the app consumes temperature measurements from a Bluetooth device that implements the Bluetooth LE Health Thermometer Service.

segment.source: The app specifies that it wants to be notified when a new temperature measurement is available.
segment.target: The app specifies that it wants to be notified when a new temperature measurement is available.

segment.source: By registering an event handler for the "Thermometer Characteristic Value Changed" event, the app will receive characteristic value changed event notifications while it is running in the foreground.
segment.target: By registering an event handler for the "Thermometer Characteristic Value Changed" event, the app will receive characteristic value changed event notifications while it is running in the foreground.

segment.source: Note that when the app is suspended, it must release all device resources and when it resumes, it must perform device enumeration and initialization once again.
segment.target: Note that when the app is suspended, it must release all device resources and when it resumes, it must perform device enumeration and initialization once again.

segment.source: Control a Bluetooth LE thermometer device
segment.target: Control a Bluetooth LE thermometer device

segment.source: In this example, an UWP app acts as a controller for a fictitious Bluetooth LE Thermometer device.
segment.target: In this example, an UWP app acts as a controller for a fictitious Bluetooth LE Thermometer device.

segment.source: The device also declares a format characteristic which allows users to retrieve the value reading in either Celsius or Fahrenheit degrees, in addition to the standard characteristics of the HealthThermometer profile.
segment.target: The device also declares a format characteristic which allows users to retrieve the value reading in either Celsius or Fahrenheit degrees, in addition to the standard characteristics of the HealthThermometer profile.

segment.source: The app uses reliable write transactions to make sure that the format and measurement interval are set as a single value.
segment.target: The app uses reliable write transactions to make sure that the format and measurement interval are set as a single value.

segment.source: Control the presentation of Bluetooth LE device data
segment.target: Control the presentation of Bluetooth LE device data

segment.source: A Bluetooth LE devices may expose a battery service that provides the current battery level to the user.
segment.target: A Bluetooth LE devices may expose a battery service that provides the current battery level to the user.

segment.source: The battery service includes an optional PresentationFormats descriptor which allows some flexibility in interpretation of the battery level data.
segment.target: The battery service includes an optional PresentationFormats descriptor which allows some flexibility in interpretation of the battery level data.

segment.source: This scenario provides example of an app that works with such a device and uses the PresentationFormats property to format a characteristic value, before presenting it to the user.
segment.target: This scenario provides example of an app that works with such a device and uses the PresentationFormats property to format a characteristic value, before presenting it to the user.
